text: The level of organization of the organism is
The organism belongs to the Phylum
explanation:
The organism in question is the euglena.
Euglena, is a genus of euglenoids, which is classified within the phylum Euglenozoa. While some older classifications placed them in the algal phylum Euglenophyta, the current consensus is Euglenozoa.

text: A plant cell placed in a solution with a higher water potential will

options.D: decrease in size and become flaccid

explanation: If a plant cell is placed in a solution with a higher water potential, it will absorb water by osmosis, causing the cell to swell and become turgid (firm and swollen) due to the pressure exerted on the cell wall by the incoming water.

text: Offspring formed by sexual reproduction exhibit more variation than those formed by asexual reproduction because

options.A: greater amount of DNA is involved in sexual reproduction
options.B: gametes of parents have different genetic composition
options.C: genetic materials come from parents of two different species
options.D: sexual reproduction is a lengthy process

text: Radius and ulna are bones of the?
explanation: Our forearm contains two long, parallel bones: the ulna and the radius. The ulna is the longer and larger of the two bones, residing on the medial (pinky finger) side of the forearm.

text: The blood vessel which carries blood from the alimentary canal to the liver is the?
explanation: The portal vein or hepatic portal vein (HPV) is a blood vessel that carries blood from the gastrointestinal tract, gallbladder, pancreas and spleen to the liver. This blood contains nutrients and toxins extracted from digested contents.

The diagram above is an illustration of a type of eye defect in humans. Study it and answer this question.
The eye defect illustrated in the diagram is?
explanation: Myopia occurs whenthe shape of your eye causes light rays to bend (refract) incorrectly, focusing images in front of your retina instead of on your retina.

text:
The diagram above is an illustration of a type of eye defect in humans. Study it and answer this question.
The eye defect can be corrected by the use of?
explanation:
Nearsightedness (myopia) is corrected with lenses called “minus power lenses.”
They are concave-shaped and help the eyes focus light properly. Myopia causes a person to see distant objects as blurry.

text: Which of the following factors is not necessary for photosynthesis?
Autotrophic nutrition is a process whereby an organism obtains food

options.B: by synthesizing simple substances using energy
options.C: from other organisms in exchange for some products
options.D: in a synthesized form, from other living organisms

text: The process that takes place at the light stage of photosynthesis is?

options.A: splitting of water molecules to form hydrogen ions
options.B: reduction of carbon (IV) oxide to form carbohydrate
options.C: formation of two molecules of phosphoglyceric acid
options.D: breaking down of ATP molecules to produce energy

explanation: one of the processes that take place in the light-dependent stage of photosynthesis is the photolysis of water, i.e. the splitting of water molecules.

text: The following organisms are examples of carnivorous plants except.
Plants and animals of an ecosystem make up a?
explanation: A community is a group of interacting organisms that may be of the same species or not as long as they share a common habitat.

text: Rabbits cannot survive in an aquatic habitat because they have

The illustration below is a food chain.
Grass→grasshopper→domestic fowl→hawk
What would happen if the population of domestic fowl decreases?
Which of the following features is a characteristic of aquatic plants possession of ?
explanation: Succulent stems are thick, fleshy stems that can store water. This is an important adaptation for aquatic plants as it helps them float and stay buoyant in the water. Additionally, succulent stems also help these plants store water during times of drought or when they are partially exposed to air.

text: Which of the following statements about sickle cell anaemia is correct?

options.A: it is caused by sex-linked genes
options.B: it is more common in males than in females
options.C: two sickle cell carrier parents may have a sickling child
options.D: it is caused by recessive genes

text: In humans, pointed eyebrows (B) is a dominant trait over smooth eyebrows (b). A student and the mother have smooth eyebrows while the father has pointed eyebrows. What is the genotype of the father?
explanation: The father is heterogeneous pointed eyebrows Bb

text: A woman with Rhesus negative blood group was advised not to marry a man with Rhesus positive blood group because

options.A: it will hinder her from having blood transfusion from her husband
options.B: it will result in sickness and probably death of the offspring
options.C: her children may all resemble her husband
options.D: it may affect her childbearing ability

explanation: Rh factor is a protein found in blood. A person with Rh factor in blood is called Rh positive whereas one who does not carry this protein in the blood is called Rh negative. Marriage should be avoided between Rh-negative females & Rh-positive males. This can be fatal for the mother as well as the baby of such parents. (second pregnancy may result in erythroblastosis fetalis if necessary precautions are not taken).

text: Which of the following organisms exhibits division of labour?
Natural selection arises as a result of?
explanation:
Natural selection is the result of genetic variation, environmental pressures, and competition for resources.
Genetic variation as a result of the following:
Mutations: Create new genotypesSexual reproduction: Increases genetic variationHeritable traits: Passed from parent to offspring

text: Which of the following statements is not Lamarck's postulate on evolution?

options.A: great changes in the environment result in corresponding changes in species
options.B: frequently used organs become well developed while the ones not used become vestigial
options.C: well developed acquired characters are inheritable
options.D: survivors in a competitive community must have inherited useful traits
